symbols.name: sap.ui.webc.main.Tree
symbols.description:
Overview

The sap.ui.webc.main.Tree component provides a tree structure for displaying data in a hierarchy.

Usage

When to use:

  • To display hierarchically structured items.
  • To select one or more items out of a set of hierarchically structured items.

When not to use:

  • To display items not hierarchically strcutured. In this case, use the List component.
  • To select one item from a very small number of non-hierarchical items. Select or ComboBox might be more appropriate.
  • The hierarchy turns out to have only two levels. In this case, use List with group items.

Keyboard Handling

The sap.ui.webc.main.Tree provides advanced keyboard handling. The user can use the following keyboard shortcuts in order to navigate trough the tree:
  • [UP/DOWN] - Navigates up and down the tree items that are currently visible.
  • [RIGHT] - Drills down the tree by expanding the tree nodes.
  • [LEFT] - Goes up the tree and collapses the tree nodes.

The user can use the following keyboard shortcuts to perform selection, when the mode property is in use:
  • [SPACE] - Selects the currently focused item upon keyup.
  • [ENTER] - Selects the currently focused item upon keydown.

experimental.text: This control is experimental and its API might change significantly.

properties.name: accessibleName
properties.description: Defines the accessible name of the component.

properties.name: footerText
properties.description: Defines the component footer text.

properties.name: headerText
properties.description:
Defines the component header text.

Note: If the header slot is set, this property is ignored.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Defines the height of the control

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Defines the mode of the component. Since the tree uses a sap.ui.webc.main.List to display its structure, the tree modes are exactly the same as the list modes, and are all applicable.

Note:
  • None
  • SingleSelect
  • SingleSelectBegin
  • SingleSelectEnd
  • MultiSelect
  • Delete

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Defines the text that is displayed when the component contains no items.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control

aggregations.name: header
aggregations.description:
Defines the component header.

Note: When the header slot is set, the headerText property is ignored.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
Defines the items of the component. Tree items may have other tree items as children.

Note: Use sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItem for the intended design.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Receives id(or many ids) of the controls that label this control.

events.name: itemClick
events.description: Fired when a tree item is activated.

events.name: itemDelete
events.description:
Fired when the Delete button of any tree item is pressed.

Note: A Delete button is displayed on each item, when the component mode property is set to Delete.

events.name: itemMouseout
events.description: Fired when the mouse cursor leaves the tree item borders.

events.name: itemMouseover
events.description: Fired when the mouse cursor enters the tree item borders.

events.name: itemToggle
events.description: Fired when a tree item is expanded or collapsed. Note: You can call preventDefault() on the event object to suppress the event, if needed. This may be handy for example if you want to dynamically load tree items upon the user expanding a node. Even if you prevented the event's default behavior, you can always manually call toggle() on a tree item.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: Fired when selection is changed by user interaction in SingleSelect, SingleSelectBegin, SingleSelectEnd and MultiSelect modes.

selectedItems.name: selectedItems
selectedItems.description: An array of the selected items.

previouslySelectedItems.name: previouslySelectedItems
previouslySelectedItems.description: An array of the previously selected items.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItem
symbols.description:
Overview

The sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItem represents a node in a tree structure, shown as a sap.ui.webc.main.List.
This is the item to use inside a sap.ui.webc.main.Tree. You can represent an arbitrary tree structure by recursively nesting tree items.

CSS Shadow Parts

{@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/::part CSS Shadow Parts} allow developers to style elements inside the Shadow DOM.
The sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItem exposes the following CSS Shadow Parts:
  • title - Used to style the title of the tree list item
  • additionalText - Used to style the additionalText of the tree list item
  • icon - Used to style the icon of the tree list item

experimental.text: This control is experimental and its API might change significantly.

properties.name: accessibilityAttributes
properties.description:
An object of strings that defines several additional accessibility attribute values for customization depending on the use case. It supports the following fields:
  • ariaSetsize: Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems when not all items in the set are present in the DOM. The value of each aria-setsize is an integer reflecting number of items in the complete set. Note: If the size of the entire set is unknown, set aria-setsize="-1".
  • ariaPosinset: Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems when not all items are present in the DOM. The value of each aria-posinset is an integer greater than or equal to 1, and less than or equal to the size of the set when that size is known.

properties.name: accessibleName
properties.description: Defines the accessible name of the component.

properties.name: additionalText
properties.description: Defines the additionalText, displayed in the end of the tree item.

properties.name: additionalTextState
properties.description:
Defines the state of the additionalText.
Available options are: "None" (by default), "Success", "Warning", "Information" and "Error".

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Defines whether the tree list item will show a collapse or expand icon inside its toggle button.

properties.name: hasChildren
properties.description:
Defines whether the tree node has children, even if currently no other tree nodes are slotted inside.
Note: This property is useful for showing big tree structures where not all nodes are initially loaded due to performance reasons. Set this to true for nodes you intend to load lazily, when the user clicks the expand button. It is not necessary to set this property otherwise. If a tree item has children, the expand button will be displayed anyway.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: If set, an icon will be displayed before the text of the tree list item.

properties.name: indeterminate
properties.description:
Defines whether the selection of a tree node is displayed as partially selected.

Note: The indeterminate state can be set only programmatically and can’t be achieved by user interaction, meaning that the resulting visual state depends on the values of the indeterminate and selected properties:
  • If a tree node has both selected and indeterminate set to true, it is displayed as partially selected.
  • If a tree node has selected set to true and indeterminate set to false, it is displayed as selected.
  • If a tree node has selected set to false, it is displayed as not selected regardless of the value of the indeterminate property.

Note: This property takes effect only when the sap.ui.webc.main.Tree is in MultiSelect mode.

properties.name: navigated
properties.description: The navigated state of the list item. If set to true, a navigation indicator is displayed at the end of the list item.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the ListItem.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text of the tree item.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Defines the visual indication and behavior of the list items. Available options are Active (by default), Inactive, Detail and Navigation.

Note: When set to Active or Navigation, the item will provide visual response upon press and hover, while with type Inactive and Detail - will not.

aggregations.name: deleteButton
aggregations.description: Defines the delete button, displayed in "Delete" mode. Note: While the slot allows custom buttons, to match design guidelines, please use the sap.ui.webc.main.Button component. Note: When the slot is not present, a built-in delete button will be displayed.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
Defines the items of the component.

Note: Use sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItem or sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItemCustom

Fired when the user clicks on the detail button when type is Detail.

methods.name: getAccessibilityAttributes

returnValue.description: Value of property accessibilityAttributes

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getAccessibilityAttributes accessibilityAttributes}. An object of strings that defines several additional accessibility attribute values for customization depending on the use case. It supports the following fields:
  • ariaSetsize: Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems when not all items in the set are present in the DOM. The value of each aria-setsize is an integer reflecting number of items in the complete set. Note: If the size of the entire set is unknown, set aria-setsize="-1".
  • ariaPosinset: Defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems when not all items are present in the DOM. The value of each aria-posinset is an integer greater than or equal to 1, and less than or equal to the size of the set when that size is known.
Default value is {}.

methods.name: getAccessibleName

returnValue.description: Value of property accessibleName

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getAccessibleName accessibleName}.

Defines the accessible name of the component.

methods.name: getAdditionalTextState

returnValue.description: Value of property additionalTextState

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getAdditionalTextState additionalTextState}. Defines the state of the additionalText.
Available options are: "None" (by default), "Success", "Warning", "Information" and "Error". Default value is None.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}. Defines the content of the sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItem.

methods.name: getDeleteButton
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDeleteButton deleteButton}. Defines the delete button, displayed in "Delete" mode. Note: While the slot allows custom buttons, to match design guidelines, please use the sap.ui.webc.main.Button component. Note: When the slot is not present, a built-in delete button will be displayed.

methods.name: getExpanded

returnValue.description: Value of property expanded

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getExpanded expanded}. Defines whether the tree list item will show a collapse or expand icon inside its toggle button. Default value is false.

methods.name: getHasChildren

returnValue.description: Value of property hasChildren

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHasChildren hasChildren}. Defines whether the tree node has children, even if currently no other tree nodes are slotted inside.
Note: This property is useful for showing big tree structures where not all nodes are initially loaded due to performance reasons. Set this to true for nodes you intend to load lazily, when the user clicks the expand button. It is not necessary to set this property otherwise. If a tree item has children, the expand button will be displayed anyway. Default value is false.

methods.name: getHideSelectionElement

returnValue.description: Value of property hideSelectionElement

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHideSelectionElement hideSelectionElement}. Defines whether the tree list item should display the selection element. Default value is false.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Value of property icon

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIcon icon}. If set, an icon will be displayed before the text of the tree list item. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getIndeterminate

returnValue.description: Value of property indeterminate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIndeterminate indeterminate}. Defines whether the selection of a tree node is displayed as partially selected.

Note: The indeterminate state can be set only programmatically and can’t be achieved by user interaction, meaning that the resulting visual state depends on the values of the indeterminate and selected properties:
  • If a tree node has both selected and indeterminate set to true, it is displayed as partially selected.
  • If a tree node has selected set to true and indeterminate set to false, it is displayed as selected.
  • If a tree node has selected set to false, it is displayed as not selected regardless of the value of the indeterminate property.

Note: This property takes effect only when the sap.ui.webc.main.Tree is in MultiSelect mode. Default value is false.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getItems items}. Defines the items of the component.

Note: Use sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItem or sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItemCustom

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.webc.main.TreeItemCustom.

methods.name: getNavigated

returnValue.description: Value of property navigated

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNavigated navigated}. The navigated state of the list item. If set to true, a navigation indicator is displayed at the end of the list item.

methods.name: getSelected

returnValue.description: Value of property selected

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelected selected}. Defines the selected state of the ListItem. Default value is false.

methods.name: getType

returnValue.description: Value of property type

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getType type}. Defines the visual indication and behavior of the list items. Available options are Active (by default), Inactive, Detail and Navigation.

Note: When set to Active or Navigation, the item will provide visual response upon press and hover, while with type Inactive and Detail - will not. Default value is Active.
